prompt: <description>**Intermediate CAD Part 1** **Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [*-90.0*, 0.0, *-90.0*] and the translation vector to [0.375, 0.0, 0.0]. Now, let's create the 2D sketch. The sketch contains three faces (face\\_1, face\\_2, and face\\_3). Face 1: - Start by creating a loop (loop\\_1). - Within this loop, create four lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, and line\\_4). - Define the start and end points of these lines as follows: - line\\_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.1692, 0.0] - line\\_2: [0.1692, 0.0] to [0.1692, 0.2538] - line\\_3: [0.1692, 0.2538] to [0.0, 0.2538] - line\\_4: [0.0, 0.2538] to [0.0, 0.0] Face 2: - Create another loop (loop\\_1). - Within this loop, create six lines (line\\_1 to line\\_6). - Define the start and end points of these lines as follows: - line\\_1: [0.0, 0.2538] to [0.1692, 0.2538] - line\\_2: [0.1692, 0.2538] to [0.265, 0.2538] - line\\_3: [0.265, 0.2538] to [0.265, 0.3383] - line\\_4: [0.265, 0.3383] to [0.1269, 0.3383] - line\\_5: [0.1269, 0.3383] to [0.0, 0.3383] - line\\_6: [0.0, 0.3383] to [0.0, 0.2538] Face 3: - Create a final loop (loop\\_1). - Within this loop, create four lines (line\\_1 to line\\_4). - Define the start and end points of these lines as follows: - line\\_1: [0.0, 0.3383] to [0.1269, 0.3383] - line\\_2: [0.1269, 0.3383] to [0.1269, 0.5075] - line\\_3: [0.1269, 0.5075] to [0.0, 0.5075] - line\\_4: [0.0, 0.5075] to [0.0, 0.3383] To transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch, scale it using a scaling parameter of 0.5075. Apply a 3D rotation using the specified euler angles and translate it using the defined translation vector. Now, extrude the sketch along the normal vector with a depth of 0.1875 and an equal depth in the opposite direction. This constitutes the construction of the first intermediate CAD part, which will be integrated with subsequent CAD models through a join operation (adding material). The length of this part is 0.375, its width is 0.5075, and the height is 0.5075 (before scaling and extruding).</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 3 units in length, 2 units in width, and 1 unit in height. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) - Translation Vector: (0.0, 0.075, 0.0) 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Create a rectangle with the following loops and lines: - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.75, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.3713) - Arc 1: Start Point (0.75, 0.3713), Mid Point (0.7489, 0.3739), End Point (0.7463, 0.375) - Line 3: Start Point (0.7463, 0.375), End Point (0.0038, 0.375) - Arc 2: Start Point (0.0038, 0.375), Mid Point (0.0011, 0.3739), End Point (0.0, 0.3713) - Line 4: Start Point (0.0, 0.3713), End Point (0.0, 0.0) 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.075 units to generate the 3D model. Since this is the first part in the CAD assembly, no boolean operation is required. Proceed with the next parts and their respective operations as indicated in the CAD assembly JSON. Remember to follow the same instructions for each part, modifying only the starting shape, dimensions, and any necessary transformation details.</description>

The dimensions of the prism are approximately 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.4991, 0.0] 2. Constrain the loop: - Close the loop. 4. Draw the second face of the prism (bottom face): - Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.7486] to point [0.7486, 0.7486]. - Draw a line from point [0.7486, 0.7486] to point [0.7486, 0.4995]. - Draw a line from point [0.7486, 0.4995] to point [0.4991, 0.4995]. - Draw a line from point [0.4991, 0.4995] to point [0.2778, 0.0]. - Draw a line from point [0.2778, 0.0] to point [0.0, 0.0]. 5. Constrain the loop: - Close the loop. 6. Scale the 2D sketch by 75%. 7. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 8. The resulting prism would have the given shape and dimensions as provided in the description of the part.</description>
